div.l: And vp he rist ful eseli ⁊and in bi þe wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vpp right / and fast she slepte
Til he so nigh was or þat she might aspie
Þat it had be to late for to crie
And shortli for to sey þei were at one
Now plei Aleyn for I wol speke of Iohn
This Iohn lieth still a forlonge wey or two
And to him self he made reuthe and wo
Allas qduod he þis is a wicked iape
Now may I sey þat I am but an Ape
Yit hath my felawe som what for his harme
He hath þe myllers dought̉er in his arme
And auntred him and hath his nedꝭes spedde
But I ly as a draf sak in my bedde
And whan þis Iape is told a noþer day
I shal be hold a daf a Cokenay
I wil arise and aunter me bi my feith
· And vp he riseth]And vp he riseth Vn hardi vnseli as men seith
div.note: The scribe marks the miscopied clause for deletion, but it is neither scraped nor subpuncted.
div.l: And vp he riseth · and softly he went
Vnto þe cradel and in his armes it hent
And bare it softli vnto his beddis fete
Sone aftr͗e þe wife hir routing lete
And gan a wake and went hir͗e to pisse
And came a gayne and gan hir͗e cradel mysse
And creped and þer͗e coude she finde none
Alas qduod she I had almoost mysgone
I had almost go to þe clerkez bed
Ey benedicite þan had I euel sped
And forth she goeth til she þe cradell fonde
She gropeth alwey forth with hir͗e honde
And fonde þe clerkez bed and þouȝt not but gode
Bi cause þat þe cradell bi it stode
And wist not where she was for it was dirke
And faire and well she crept into þe clerke
And lieth full still and wold haue caught a slepe
With in a while þis Iohn þe clerk vp lept
On þat goode wife and laid on sore
So meri a fit she had not ful yore
He prikketh hard and depe as he wer͗e madde
Þis Ioly life þies two clerkez ladde
Til þat þe þirde cok began to syng
Alayn was al wery in þe daunyng
For he hadde swinked al þe long night
